title: Resume
text:
Technical Skills







Type
Skills




Languages
Java, Python, C/C++, SQL (Postgres), JavaScript, HTML/CSS, R, LaTeX, Bash, Shell


Frameworks
Node.js, Pytest, Unittest, JUnit, WordPress


Developer Tools
Git, VS Code, Visual Studio, Oracle, PyCharm, IntelliJ, Eclipse, Unity, Java 8+, MS Excel


Libraries
pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, React, GNU C, Standard C libraries






Education
University of Toronto Canada Bachelor of Science in Statistics and Economics, Minor in Computer Science Sep. 2021 – April 2025 Relevant Coursework: Data Analysis, Machine Learning, DSA, Advanced Programming, Probability Introduction to Game Development in Python Toronto, CAN GameDev Certification Program teaching game development using Python programming language. May. 2021 – Sep 2021 DEERHACKS III Hackathon Toronto, CAN Developed an algorithm to eradicate phantom traffic. The DevPost for the project can be found here: Link



Experience
Programming Instructor/Sensei May 2023 – Sept 2023 Code Ninjas | JavaScript, C #, Unity, Block, MakeCode, SpringBoot, MongoDB Brampton, ONT • Organized and executed a Hackathon targeting children aged 8-14, creating coding enthusiasm in the tech industry. • Facilitated a seamless transition from Scratch coding/GDP JavaScript to MS Makecode (IMPACT) upon the collaboration with Microsoft. This led to a 25% increase in the number of students joining the institution. • Instructed children in coding, Mathematics, and robotics, learning adaptability and problem-solving skills.
Facilitated Study Group Leader Jan. 2022 – Present University of Toronto | Communication, Collaboration, OOP, Python, Probability Mississauga, ONT • Showcased proficiency in teaching economics concepts, coupled with advanced proficiency in Python programming. • Taught the concepts of economic fundamentals like Supply and demand, Utility, Costs of Production, GDP,etc. • Developed strong facilitation skills through leading group discussions and activities, while honing my ability to communicate complex concepts and engage with the community.



Projects
Data Analysis Paper on Suicide PCI Calls Event Patterns | R, Quarto, Git, GitHub, Data Visualization • Conducted an in-depth analysis of Toronto Police Services’ 10-year Persons in Crisis Calls dataset, revealing a direct correlation between suicide events and factors such as time of day, day of the week, and geographic location, aiming to enhance crisis response strategies and community well-being. Available at: GitHub Repository.
Data Analysis Paper on Student Performance COVID-19 US States Factors | Quarto,GitHub, SSRP • Conducted collaborative data analysis with a team of three researchers, assessing the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on student performance in 11 U.S. states, identifying significant correlations between various factors and learning losses, and contributing to a published paper titled ”Assessing Factors Affecting Student’s Performance during COVID-19 Pandemic” available for replication on the Social Science Reproduction platform. Paper Github link: Repository Link
Compressor/decompressor TreeMap | Pytest, Python, PyGame, BST/Huffman Trees/Sorting/OOP • A file management software employing tree structures, BSTs, and Huffman trees to manipulate files through deletion, compression, and expansion, while visually categorizing and encrypting each file based on its type.
Interactive Graphical Interfaced Boggle Game | Unittest,UML, MVC,VS Code, Java, Git • Led a diverse team of four programmers in the collaborative development of the Boggle Game with GUI and various features, promoting a culture of shared learning and skill enhancement, prioritizing user accessibility with features like eye care mode, and implementing agile methodology for efficient development.

title: Who Am I?
text:
Greetings! I’m Vanshika Vanshika – an enthusiast fueled by curiosity and driven by passion. My academic journey intertwines the realms of Statistics and Economics, with a sprinkle of Computer Science, all crafted at the esteemed University of Toronto. As I tread the path towards my Bachelor’s degree, I’ve immersed myself in the boundless expanse of technology and data analytics, honing my craft in languages such as Java, Python, and C/C++. Each line of code I write is a brushstroke on the canvas of innovation, painting a vivid picture of endless possibilities.


Outside of the tech world, I find solace and exhilaration in the art of boxing. It’s not just a sport for me; it’s a discipline that instills focus, resilience, and determination. The ring is where I challenge myself physically and mentally, pushing beyond limits to achieve personal growth.
But my interests don’t stop there. I’m also an avid painter and dancer. Painting allows me to unleash my creativity onto canvas, while dancing is my expression of joy and freedom. These creative outlets enrich my life and bring balance to my pursuit of technical excellence.



My journey extends beyond lines of code. I’ve been involved in various projects and experiences that have honed my communication, leadership, and problem-solving abilities.
As a Programming Instructor at Code Ninjas, I had the opportunity to inspire young minds in the world of coding and technology. Organizing hackathons, facilitating learning sessions, and witnessing the spark of curiosity in my students have been incredibly rewarding experiences.
At the University of Toronto, I’ve not only excelled academically but also taken on roles as a facilitator and study group leader. Teaching economics concepts and guiding discussions have refined my ability to communicate complex ideas effectively.



I’ve had the privilege of working on impactful projects that leverage data analysis to address real-world issues. From analyzing patterns in suicide calls to assessing the impact of COVID-19 on student performance, I’ve delved into diverse datasets to glean insights that contribute to community well-being and policy-making.
Additionally, my passion for software development led me to create innovative solutions like a file management software employing tree structures and an interactive graphical interface Boggle game, showcasing my proficiency in software design and development methodologies.

title: Welcome to my Personal Website!
text:
Hello Guests,
My name is Vanshika Vanshika and I am an undergraduate student at University of Toronto, majoring in Statistics and Economics and minor in Computer Science.
